intro: Fimbristylis schlechteri, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and swamps. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brown flowers. It is native to regions in Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical climates. Fimbristylis schlechteri plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
